body.div1:
William Robertson to Robert Carter and John Lightfoot
Williamsburgh[, Virginia] June the 27th 1705
Sr.
His Excellency haveing just now received advice from Capt. Josiah Moon of Her Majestys Ship the Oxford that he and another man of war arrived last night at Kiquotan finds it necessary for Her Majestys Service to have a meeting of the Councill here on Saturday the 30th Instant at which he expects Yor. Honors will not fail to give Yor. attendance which by His Excellencys Command is all from
Yor. Honrs. most obedient humble Servt.
WIL ROBERTSON

div1.head: Notes
div1.sourcedesc: sourcedesc>State Archives, New York State Education Department, Albany. Series #A1894, Series #A1894, New York Colonial Administrative Records, Vol. 51, 41a- c.
